tool.name: Flow Accumulation (Top-Down)
tool.description: Top-down processing of cells for calculation of flow accumulation and related parameters. This set of algorithms processes a DEM downwards from the highest to the lowest cell.<br/><br/>Flow routing methods provided by this tool:<ul><li>Deterministic 8 (aka D8, O'Callaghan & Mark 1984)</li><li>Braunschweiger Reliefmodell (Bauer et al. 1985)</li><li>Rho 8 (Fairfield & Leymarie 1991)</li><li>Multiple Flow Direction (Freeman 1991, Quinn et al. 1991)</li><li>Deterministic Infinity (Tarboton 1997)</li><li>Triangular Multiple Flow Direction (Seibert & McGlynn 2007</li><li>Multiple Flow Direction based on Maximum Downslope Gradient (Qin et al. 2011)</li></ul>

param.name: STEP
param.label: Step
param.help: For testing purposes. Only generate flow at cells with step distance (each step row/column).

param.name: LINEAR_VAL
param.label: Linear Flow Threshold Grid
param.help: optional grid providing values to be compared with linear flow threshold instead of flow accumulation

param.name: LINEAR_DIR
param.label: Channel Direction
param.help: use this for (linear) flow routing, if the value is a valid direction (0-7 = N, NE, E, SE, S, SW, W, NW)

param.name: LINEAR_DO
param.label: Thresholded Linear Flow
param.help: apply linear flow routing (D8) to all cells, having a flow accumulation greater than the specified threshold

param.name: LINEAR_MIN
param.label: Linear Flow Threshold
param.help: flow accumulation threshold (cells) for linear flow routing

param.name: CONVERGENCE
param.label: Convergence
param.help: Convergence factor for Multiple Flow Direction Algorithm (Freeman 1991).<br/>Applies also to the Multiple Triangular Flow Directon Algorithm.

param.name: NO_NEGATIVES
param.label: Prevent Negative Flow Accumulation
param.help: when using weights: do not transport negative flow, set it to zero instead; useful e.g. when accumulating measures of water balance.
